TopicTitle: What planet scares you the most?

Articles.Content: Kerbin. It hates me.
Ike, I don't know how I managed this, but when I was landing my polar rover at about 15000 M, I got slammed by the magic bolder. I am not joking, so ever since I have never gone back or ever want to.

If you're going for unmanned probes you could actually land there with a simple X200-16 fuel tank and four orange radials.

This is the craft I did it with.

Challenge accepted! Landing achieved!

Here is my Tylo Surveyor on final descent. With a full compliment of scientific instruments I add a few extra fuel tanks.

Touchdown.

Transmitting data back to Kerbin.

Once I figured out the correct angle of descent it was a piece of cake. I even had over 100 units of fuel left.

Edited October 27, 2013 by Landge

Changed my mind, it's GP2/Gas planet 2

So white and eerie

Bop. That's where the krakens live!

Just kidding, it's actually Moho.

Eve. You add an L to the end of Eve and you get exactly what that bowl of soup is.

If you ever stick a spoon out into its atmosphere, you have yourself some hot, steaming soup.
Eeloo, once you're out in that eliptical loop there's a real good chance you're going to run short on fuel on the way back.
Jool. I've lost more ships arriving at Jool than all other bodies (Including Jool's moons) combined.

I don't hate a celestial bodies.

But if you push it...

It's the Mun. Only one manned expedition was sent, and it blew up and crashed while attempting to take off, stranding three kerbalonauts who died anyway because a poodle engine smashed into their capsule. Prior to this, all attempted landings had flipped over, and two probes had suddenly failed in Munar orbit.

Which is why I wisely decided to abandon all hopes for the Mun and focus on interplanetary manned missions.

Jool.

It doesn't have the barren feel of Duna or Dres. It doesn't have the solar intimidation of Moho.

But travelling around the Joolian system is like being a pinball in a cosmic pinball machine. Invisible spheres of influence are menacing around every turn, and since you're in orbit, turning is happening rather a lot!

Jool is crazy town for unintended gravity slingshots.
Earth... If you're kerbal, avoid that planet at any cost. There are only rumours what they do with the little green kerbals...
Moho. The Moholes are terrifying. Let's send Jeb!

Eve.

It's the only body where I'm daunted by the potential task of building a single launch craft with the Mk1-2 Command Pod that can land and return.

For one the lander needs to basically be a mobile rocket platform in order to drive it to the highest peak on Eve, and it's gonna weight something like 400 tons, and the part count is gonna be completely insane O_O
None really as most are easy to get to... maybe not back though! I have not attempted a manned Eve accent yet, it's on my list, maybe this week.

Eve

It's the one planet I have not yet landed on yet, as I don't want my kerbs left there, for some reason.

And I have to make the Kerbal Super Carrier 3 Grand Tour ship soon, and make a Eve lander... dear gosh...

Gilly because you feel so fragile. Landing takes forever and if you dare to take a step you might end up floating away.

Honestly if you coughed on Gilly that would be the end of your mission.
After watching Apollo 18 recently, it is fair to say I'll never visit the mun. Ever.
Definitley Jool, Nothing terrifies me quite like this Ominous Behemoth slowly rising over the horizon...

Bop. That's where the krakens live!

Bop is scary, but I'm not afraid of it

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/37109-Easter-Hunt-%28no-spoilers-though%29-%28picture-heavy%29

Why I think it's scary.

Edited November 16, 2013 by Mr. Rogue Ace

Got to be Eve

Managed flybys, probe landings but never managed to do a manned return using stock parts, the planet simply eats Kerbals for breakfast !

Currently working on a 3 launch mission, so will see how it goes this time :-)
Eve. One way trip no matter what I do. And the colour is freaky over time.
Eeloo, it's just so lonely
Eeloo I have blown up for unexplainable reasons too many times I am talking cheaty crafts with 5000000 impact resistance. Also I swear there are strange lights there.
Um, seriously? Afraid of planets? No. Can't say that I am. But the planets are probably a bit apprehensive about my pelting them with landers.
Probably Vall. The icy surface and small sun seems to echo the dust of fallen civilizations, especially when you're looking at the stonehenge.
